results.title: Adam and Eve
results.brief_description: An animated film using abstract cutouts, symbolising life, reproduction, growth and destruction from creation to the end of the world in an explosion, then the beginning of a new cycle.
results.description: An animated film using abstract cutouts, symbolising life, reproduction, growth and destruction from creation to the end of the world in an explosion, then the beginning of a new cycle.

results.title: Aboriginal canoe trees of the Murray
results.creator_credit: Robert Edwards, South Australian Museum and Australian Institute of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Studies
results.brief_description: Aborigines of the lower Murray River formerly made large canoes from the bark of Red Gum trees. This film documents the felling of a canoe tree from the sides of the Murray and its transportation to the South Australian Museum for preservation.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Edwards, South Australian Museum and Australian Institute of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Studies
results.description: Aborigines of the lower Murray River formerly made large canoes from the bark of Red Gum trees. This film documents the felling of a canoe tree from the sides of the Murray and its transportation to the South Australian Museum for preservation.
description_for_label: Aborigines of the lower Murray River formerly made large canoes from the bark of Red Gum trees. This film documents the felling of a canoe tree from the sides of the Murray and its transportation to the South Australian Museum for preservation.

results.title: Abakanowicz in Australia
results.creator_credit: Christopher McGill, Malcolm Otton, Crafts Council of Australia and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Polish artist Magdalena Abakanowicz prepares for an exhibition of her work in Australia. We see her exhibits of large rope, hessian and string three-dimensional forms. She comments upon her intended purpose in working with such materials. Narrated by Margaret Throsby.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Christopher McGill, Malcolm Otton, Crafts Council of Australia and Film Australia

results.title: Fifty Years of Service
results.creator_credit: Shan Benson and State Electricity Commission of Victoria
results.brief_description: The first fifty years of the State Electricity Commission is presented by means of archival film detailing highlights of the development of the power authority for Victoria - from 1919 to the completion of the giant Hazelwood power complex.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Shan Benson and State Electricity Commission of Victoria

results.title: The Affliction of Memory
results.creator_credit: Zeina Zogheib, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: For Zeina Zogheib the aroma of coffee and the fragrant scent of gardenia bring memories of Lebanon flooding back. A place Zeina and her family fled, due to the ravages of war.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Zeina Zogheib, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Loving Lebanon and Australia
results.creator_credit: Sam Haddad, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When Lebanese immigrant Sam Haddad migrated to Australia he encountered ignorance and racism but via a well timed punch, he learned the value of mateship and tolerance and began to love his adopted country.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sam Haddad, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: An Inner passion
results.creator_credit: Hung Lin and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description:
Hand-drawn 2-D animated moral tale of a baker and his assistant and how one person’s passion can inspire and change the actions of their bullying and intolerant boss.
Original music score by James Hodson. No dialogue.
Graduate work from an AIM (Centre for Animation and Interactive Media) RMIT graduate, 2006.

results.title: Carnaval
results.creator_credit: Juan Serrano and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description:
A computer animated story of myth, magic and power and two alien beings spirited away to planet Earth. No dialogue. Original music score by SISMO.
Graduate work from an AIM (Centre for Animation and Interactive Media) RMIT graduate, 2006.

results.title: New love
results.creator_credit: Jayt Buchanan and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description:
A captivating piece of animation about the wonderment of new love - the hopes and dreams and the possibilities. Dialogue is replaced by the simple flowing of words as they weave in and out and around the lovers. Music score adapted from the track New Love by Cam Butler and Silver Ray.
Graduate work from an AIM (Centre for Animation and Interactive Media) RMIT graduate, 2006.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jayt Buchanan and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.description:
A captivating piece of animation about the wonderment of new love - the hopes and dreams and the possibilities. Dialogue is replaced by the simple flowing of words as they weave in and out and around the lovers. Music score adapted from the track New Love by Cam Butler and Silver Ray.
